observations: Non-zero values move towards the bottom and right.
Zero values tend to move toward the top and left.
The grid maintains the same dimensions.
The number of non-zero values is the same in input and output grids.
hypotheses: Move non-zero values towards the bottom right corner, filling the empty spaces with zeros starting from top-left.

Shift all the numbers towards the bottom right as far as they can go without changing their order. If there are multiple possible solutions, favor one where they are on the bottom rows before on the rightmost columns.
selected_rule: Shift all the numbers towards the bottom right as far as they can go without changing their order. If there are multiple possible solutions, favor one where they are on the bottom rows before on the rightmost columns.
step_plan: Iterate through the input grid from left to right and top to bottom.
Create an empty output grid with the same dimensions as the input grid.
Place the non-zero numbers from the input grid to the bottom right cells of the output grid respecting their relative order, shifting zeros to the top and left.
